--- In neat@yahoogroup=
s.com, Wesley Tansey <tansey@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Chris,
> 
> I'm assuming yo=
u're using SharpNEAT 2, correct?
> 
> The CreateGenomeList method has an ov=
erload which takes a seed genome.
> Genomes are stored to disk as XML files=
 which you can create/edit by hand if
> you want. You can load a fixed-topo=
logy genome from file (see
> NeatGenomeXmlIO) and then pass it to that meth=
od as a seed. Then just change
> the reference in your INeatExperiment impl=
ementation to use your new
> CreateEvolutionAlgorithm.
> 
> You'll also wan=
t to edit your NeatGenomeParameters to set
> AddNodeMutationProbability, Ad=
dConnectionMutationProbability,
> DeleteConnectionMutationProbability, and
=
> DeleteSimpleNeuronMutationProbability equal to 0.
> 
> If you're using Sh=
arpNEAT v1, I'd recommend switching to version 2. It's a
> lot more elegant=
ly designed and offers more room for customization and
> extensibility.
> 
=
> SharpNEAT 2: https://sites.google.com/site/sharpneat/
> Code is available=
 at the bottom.
> 
> I wrote a couple tutorials on SN2 as well:
> 
> http:/=
/www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/17/tutorial-evolving-neural-networks-with-sharp=
neat-2-part-1/
> http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/07/24/tutorial-%e2%80%93-ev=
olving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-2/
> 
> Hope that helps!
> 
> =
Wesley
> 
> 
> On Fri, Oct 29, 2010 at 1:22 AM, chris2005hi <chrismnu2003@.=
..> wrote:
> 
> >

arted experimenting with

 with and evolve only standard
> > feed-forward, single-layer perceptron ne=
tworks?
> >
> >  
> >
